column5: NTA. Your family sounds abusive and out of touch w reality. As your wife I would tell them to hell no
My man has millions so I choose seeing him twice a week
Haha thank you. I have always been this way. I moved to Canada when I was 19 and LA from a small town in Michigan when I was 23. I didn‚Äôt know anyone. It always worked out somehow.
I guess you missed the part that the three of them live together and have been happily together for years. Just because you don‚Äôt believe in something, doesn‚Äôt make it a joke

I used to think that way as well. But they manage with three people, I think it would be easier with four. I‚Äôve only ever been in two-person relationships. But with them it‚Äôs just different, just as everything about our partnership has been. 

Also I just want to make it clear for anyone who makes it seems as if I‚Äôm a freeloader - I‚Äôm a graduate student and will be interning in January. I work my ass off in life and my bfs know this hence why they offered to cover the rent and groceries. I will work when I can safely find a job again and I‚Äôm interning. It‚Äôs very odd to me that people find this strange as they were doing this anyway and many of gfs in LA are taken care of as they are stay at home moms or housewives. I can see how this would be strange for a small town person though. These men are well off and don‚Äôt need my money. And believe it or not - they love me.

Mam, you do not know me or my life circumstances. I‚Äôve been living in Los Angeles (the second most expensive city in the US) with zero help for a decade. We are now in a pandemic and half the US is jobless. You have no clue about what I‚Äôve been through. But thanks for your useless advice and comments.

Well I wouldn‚Äôt expect you to understand as a judgmental, close minded person. These three have been together happily for years and poly is working out for them. Much happier than most mono relationships. I have money to support myself w food and bills, but they will be paying rent. This isn‚Äôt uncommon for many women where I live or they live (LA/miami). My last bf also paid our rent and told me to save my money, same w these men. They have more than enough than to take my money for rent lol. 

I guess I‚Äôll post an update next month to see if you were right :)

Because my father is abusive and I rather only be in that environment 24/7 if I have to be. They understand this as their family is similar.  I rather try this option out with 3 men who have done nothing but mentally, emotionally, financially, supported me in every which way. The first two bfs I clicked with in real life. I appreciate the concern, but I am not a child and made up my mind.
Best show ever. You could definitely be a candidate for their ‚Äúother way‚Äù series where the American moves to the lovers country. A new season starts in June haha

I lost my job as I said and I do not have enough savings right now to get my own place. My parents live 4 hours away and said I can live with them if I need to so I have a safety net.

I never asked for your opinion on moving. I asked if anyone has experienced this situation before. 

We have spoken everyday, all day for years. I have spoken to their therapists and real life friends. I talk to their mother. 2/3 bfs in my life came from the Internet. The only one that ended terribly and with trauma was from my last one I met in real life. 

Two of them are also from one of the wealthiest families in south Florida. Their family is very well known here and internationally. One is literally flying here to drive w me 40 hours cross country. I am grown enough and self aware at 32 to know what I‚Äôm getting into and have a back up plan. 

I think we will be just fine tbh. :)

Because it will be a lot for me to leave right now with two animals and needing to find a subleaser in these times... if I could go back to work mid May I would be okay. But I feel like this will drag on much longer than they are saying. 

My family has sent me money for this months rent. And I think if I was going to be homeless they would help again but I don‚Äôt want to keep relying on them for the biggest bill (rent). I also feel emotionally/mentally alone here and like I said I will only be eligible for the $1200 stimulus. 

I‚Äôm waiting two more weeks before I start making this big decision. It‚Äôs daunting to think about driving 38 hours alone cross country during a pandemic as a female.

I feel like my bf (has bpd) feels this guilt and shame in similar circumstances when he didn‚Äôt mean to hurt someone. If you didn‚Äôt mean to hurt her, let go of the shame and guilt and learn from what happened. Everything turned out okay in the end, practice letting it go by repeating that to yourself, journaling your feelings, etc

I can relate to this. She‚Äôs more so obsessed with me than I am her but we are very close and she‚Äôs someone who unconditionally has always loved me no matter what. 

It has been one of my lifelong fears to lose her and now she‚Äôs 64 w health problems. So it gets more scary every year.
Yep. If I start feeling like I‚Äôm not doing mentally well or depression creeps in, I will stay off for a week to a month and it lifts a lot
My brother has schizophrenia. He struggles a lot w mental illness. I‚Äôm happy he shows up when he can and does so at the best of his ability. Maybe it was recorded so you can play it back. Hugs

You should seek help from a mental health professional.

My bf has DID. If you don‚Äôt feel you‚Äôre switching conscious states (alters) nor having severe amnesia, it could be OSDD. I would google the DSM-5 criteria for dissociative disorders and OSDD and see if you find something that matches up. The best treatment for dissociative disorders is talk therapy. I would look into finding someone who specializes with dissociation.

If you feeling in crisis you can text 741741 to talk to a crisis counselor as well. I know these times are hard. I am also jobless, but so are many people. We will figure this out. Try to practice self care. My city is in lock down but we can still go for walks alone. Do whatever brings you peace and shuts them out
If you need someone to talk to you can feel free to message me. 31/F here.

Move on if he won‚Äôt commit. It won‚Äôt end well for you.
I love getting them but ONLY from Guys I like or love.

I think that depends if the answers are coming from women or men and the age group. Men become bitter and cold once rejected too many times and think that it‚Äôs because women crave toxic men. I would listen to women over men. 

Anyone who is seeking out a bad boy etc is emotionally immature and probably has trauma/issues they need to work through. That was me in my 20s and the relationships were long, but very unstable and tumultuous. It will not get you what you want, except women like this. 

Now that I‚Äôm in therapy (actually in grad school to be a therapist, lol) and older, I‚Äôm repulsed by those sorts of men and am with a guy who others would be deemed a pushover because he moves mountains for me. He‚Äôs younger (23) so his friends make fun of him for it. But our relationship is strong and close and I appreciate his kindness and vulnerability so much. 

it‚Äôs hard for me to tell what the issue is when I don‚Äôt know you or see how you interact with others. Sometimes men did come off unsafe to me when they became TOO nice or clingy too fast. I felt they could become obsessive. But if you‚Äôre contacting a normal amount, demonstrating chivalry, being chill, and letting her pretty much guide it in the beginning to her pace... you just haven‚Äôt found the right one. 

The number one thing over all is to always make sure the woman feels safe with you and you respect the boundaries that are set. 

I would talk to more *women* about this issue and see what they say.

31f here. Whenever I say this it means... I‚Äôm just not that into you. 

Dating is a numbers game. Keep self improving and keep at it. 

Maybe say you can respect that and if there‚Äôs anything you can do to improve in the future. If you‚Äôre getting the same advice over and over... take hints. Keep listening to women‚Äôs feedback. We are all different and desire different things. If it‚Äôs you, you‚Äôll hear the same pattern about yourself.

Be patient because the dating game isn‚Äôt easy. At least not if you‚Äôre not settling ;)
All of these are what I look for in a man. Mostly because it creates an atmosphere of safety and stability. Both things which I need to feel myself and free.
